author: m-glowacki
body:
**No changes to existing menus by default**

This PR introduces an HLT module implementing a second-stage anomaly detection algorithm, complementary to AXOL1TL.

The model operates on reconstructed PF candidates, muons, electrons, and photons. For each particle, the following features are used as input: pT, eta, phi, dxy, dxy_significance, and particle ID. The model produces a single anomaly score, which is used in the trigger decision.

The input tensor has shape [1, N_particles, 6], where N_particles is capped at 500 and particles are ordered by descending pT.

Please see test for example usage.

Details of the model architecture and training strategy were presented at the [TSG Meeting](https://indico.cern.ch/event/1606708/#preview:5650429)


The trained model is stored in cms-data: https://github.com/cms-data/HLTrigger-HLTfilters/pulls

HLT timing studies have been performed: https://cmshlttiming.app.cern.ch/display/maglowac/CMSSW_15_1_0.20260109_103717
title: Module to run second layer of Anomaly Detection with particle-level information in the High Level Trigger (HLT)
